document_title: Foreskin inflammation: Causes, signs and prevention
subsection_content:
There are many causes of foreskin inflammation. In particular, clearly identifying the cause will support more effective treatment of foreskin inflammation. Some common causes of foreskin inflammation include: (3)
Phimosis: The disease prevents the head of the penis from being exposed to the outside, leading to difficulty in cleaning the head of the penis. Over time, urine residue and dirt will accumulate at the tip of the penis. This is a favorable opportunity for a series of bacteria and fungi to multiply and develop strongly.; Unhealthy sex: Another common cause of balanitis is promiscuous sex, lack of safety measures, leading to an increased risk of sexually transmitted diseases such as syphilis and gonorrhea. ..., accordingly the risk of foreskin inflammation is very high.; Not cleaning or improperly cleaning the genitals: Common causes in children. Because children do not have a sense of personal hygiene; Irritability: Balanitis can occur in patients who are easily irritated by the environment or laundry products, genital hygiene products, shower gel, shampoo, etc. , the foreskin will be red and itchy for a few days, then it will stop completely.; Some diseases: Diseases such as urethritis or urinary tract infections also greatly increase the risk of balanitis.
